skill.name: example-skill
skill.description: An example skill demonstrating the basic structure. Use when user asks about examples or templates.
skill.summary: An example skill demonstrating the basic structure. Use when user asks about examples or templates.
skill.author: ChaiWithJai

security_audit.summary: This is a pure markdown-based skill containing only documentation and guidance text. No executable code, file system access, network calls, or command execution. The skill provides template examples and educational principles only.

content.value_statement: This template skill demonstrates how Claude Code skills are organized. It provides a starting point for building your own skills with proper structure and essential principles.
actual_capabilities: Provides guidance for creating new skills
Shares essential principles for skill development
Offers troubleshooting help for skill issues
limitations: Does not execute code or perform actions
Does not access files outside the skill
Does not generate or modify other skills

use_cases.title: Learn skill basics
use_cases.description: Understand how skills are structured and organized in Claude Code projects.

use_cases.title: Build first skill
use_cases.description: Use as a starting template when creating your own Claude Code skill.

use_cases.title: Reference examples
use_cases.description: Review the structure and principles for creating clear skill documentation.

prompt_templates.title: What is a skill?
prompt_templates.prompt: What is a Claude Code skill and how is it structured?

prompt_templates.title: Create a skill
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me create a new skill using the example template.

prompt_templates.title: Debug skills
prompt_templates.prompt: My skill is not working correctly. Can you help me troubleshoot it?

prompt_templates.title: Skill principles
prompt_templates.prompt: What are the essential principles for building effective Claude Code skills?

output_examples.input: What is a Claude Code skill?
output: A Claude Code skill is a structured unit of capability that helps Claude perform specific tasks. It contains documentation, principles, and intake questions that guide interactions.
Skills follow a simple structure with a SKILL.md file containing essential principles and user interaction patterns.
To use this example skill, simply ask about understanding skills, creating skills, or debugging skills.

best_practices: Start with the minimum viable skill and add complexity only when needed.
Test your skill after each change to catch issues early.
Iterate on your skill based on what works and what does not work in practice.
anti_patterns: Overcomplicating the skill with unnecessary features before understanding the basics.
Skipping testing and deploying a skill without verifying it works correctly.
Building a skill without clear principles or documented purpose.

faq.question: Is this skill compatible with all Claude products?
faq.answer: Yes, this template skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code platforms.

faq.question: What are the limits of this skill?
faq.answer: This is a documentation-only skill. It provides guidance but does not execute code or access files.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with my own skills?
faq.answer: Use this as a reference template. Copy the structure to create your own skills with custom content.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill contains only static text. No data is collected, stored, or transmitted.

faq.question: Why is my skill not working?
faq.answer: Common issues include incorrect file structure, missing SKILL.md frontmatter, or unclear intake questions.

faq.question: How does this compare to other example skills?
faq.answer: This is a minimal template focusing on structure and principles. Other examples may demonstrate specific features.
